definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Boy stole a lesson-book from one of his school-fellows and took it home to his Mother.
sentences.chinese: 有個男孩偷了同學的一本教科書，帶回家給母親。

sentences.english: "We wanted to take that experience back to Europe, " Gentz said.
sentences.chinese: “我們想要把這些經驗帶回歐洲，”根茨說。

sentences.english: Gastrointestinal disorders big investigation, the health to take home.
sentences.chinese: 胃腸道疾病大排查，把健康帶回家。

sentences.english: His father, Piye, had returned the true pharaonic customs to Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 他的父親，皮耶，將真正的法老傳統帶回了埃及。

sentences.english: Meditation, then, is bringing the mind home.
sentences.chinese: 所以，禪修就是要把心帶回家。

sentences.english: Those college girls went slumming and came home with sex diseases.
sentences.chinese: 那些大學女生跟下流的人“胡”混，帶回了性病。

sentences.english: Peng our headquarters will LeiJinYi brought home, want to let parents agree with their marriage.
sentences.chinese: 彭皓天將雷錦儀帶回了家，想讓父母同意他們的婚事。

sentences.english: I try to bring some of the outside in.
sentences.chinese: 我嘗試着將外面的陽光帶回家。

sentences.english: He then brings her heart home to feed his dog.
sentences.chinese: 隨後他將屍體的心臟帶回家餵狗。

sentences.english: By now, Ogilvie was probably back in New Orleans and being interrogated.
sentences.chinese: 奧格爾維現在可能已被帶回新奧爾良，正在受審問。

sentences.english: During a seance the medium was offering to bring people back from the other world.
sentences.chinese: 在降神會期間裏，靈媒表演把人們從其他的世界帶回。

sentences.english: He took the egg home. To his delight, he found that it was an egg of pure gold.
sentences.chinese: 他將蛋帶回家，驚喜地發現這是一個金蛋。

sentences.english: One woman handed me a note the teacher had sent home with her child.
sentences.chinese: 一位婦女遞給我一張教師託孩子帶回家的便條。

sentences.english: She hurried back to their home with her precious son.
sentences.chinese: 她匆匆忙忙地把她的寶貝兒子帶回家。

sentences.english: And all the longings and all the loss can't bring back the dead.
sentences.chinese: 所有的渴望，所有的損失都不可能帶回死者。

sentences.english: And they can always take their leftovers home without being embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 他們可能經常把剩飯剩菜帶回家，不必感到尷尬。

definition: to return to one's home country
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to send/to give as a present
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
